alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa; San Francisco; San Mateo; Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 3:51AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Moderate to heavy rain has been falling across portions of the Bay Area since last night. Law enforcement has had reports of roadway flooding so we are issuing a Flood Advisory as steady rain will continue through the morning hours. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Roadway flooding caused by excessive rainfall has already occurred and will continue through the morning hours. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda, Contra Costa, San Francisco, San Mateo and Santa Clara. * WHEN...Until 200 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas as well as small streams. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 351 AM PST, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding and ponding of roadways. Coyote Creek at Milpitas is forecast to see rising levels. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... San Jose, San Francisco, Oakland, Fremont, Hayward, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara, Berkeley, Richmond, Daly City, San Mateo, San Leandro, Redwood City, Mountain View, Alameda, Union City, Milpitas, Palo Alto, South San Francisco and Cupertino. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Slow down when you see ponding on roadways.

area.areaDesc: Alameda; Contra Costa; San Francisco; San Mateo; Santa Clara
